contentrichtext.text: {{Sidebar Economy of Puerto Rico}} '''Telecommunications in [[Puerto Rico]]''' encompasses fixed and cellular phones, internet, radio and television broadcasting. == Telephone == '''[[Telephone]]s - main lines in use:''' 1,072,456<ref>[http://www.fcc.gov/Bureaus/Common_Carrier/Reports/FCC-State_Link/IAD/lcom0705.pdf#search=%22fcc%20puerto%20rico%20telephone%20main%20lines%20in%20use%202005%22 Table 6 page 13]</ref> '''Telephones - mobile cellular:''' 2,076,698<ref>[http://www.fcc.gov/Bureaus/Common_Carrier/Reports/FCC-State_Link/IAD/lcom0705.pdf#search=%22fcc%20puerto%20rico%20telephone%20main%20lines%20in%20use%202005%22 Table 13, page 20]</ref> The '''telephone system:''' is integrated with that of the [[United States]] by high-capacity submarine cable and [[Intelsat]] with high-speed data capability '''Country Code/Area Code''' +1-787, +1-939 == Radio == The island offers 74 AM 53 FM '''[[Radio]] [[broadcasting|broadcast]] stations'''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/fields/2013.html |title=Central Intelligence Agency |publisher=Cia.gov |date= |accessdate=2012-11-22}}</ref> == Television == Puerto Rico has 18 '''[[Television]] broadcast stations''' and three stations of the [[US Armed Forces Radio and Television Service]]. In 1997, residents own 1.021 million televisions. == Internet == In 1999 there were 18 '''[[Internet Service Provider]]s (ISPs)'''. '''[[Country code]] ([[Top level domain]]):''' PR {{Portal|Puerto Rico}} ==External links== * [http://www.radiopr740.com Radio Puerto Rico] * [http://www.endi.com El Nuevo Dia] * [http://www.tutv.puertorico.pr WIPR-TV 6 & WIPM-TV 3] * [https://www.cia.gov/ The World Factbook] == References == <references /> {{North America topic|Telecommunications in}} {{Telecommunications}} [[Category:Communications in Puerto Rico| ]] [[Category:Telecommunications by country|Puerto Rico]]
